name: Nikola Tesla
description: Serbian-American inventor and electrical engineer whose revolutionary work with alternating current and electromagnetic phenomena laid the foundation for modern electrical power systems and wireless technology.
philosophy: The present is theirs; the future, for which I really worked, is mine.

historical_context.cultural_milieu: Rapid industrialization and electrification, immigrant genius in American context, scientific materialism competing with spiritualism
historical_context.political_climate: Austro-Hungarian Empire declining, American Gilded Age capitalism, World Wars transforming global technology needs
historical_context.technological_stage: Steam power transitioning to electricity, telegraph evolving toward radio, industrial mass production beginning, scientific research becoming corporate
historical_context.social_movements: Immigration to America for opportunity, patent wars over new technologies, public fascination with scientific demonstrations and world's fairs

formative_experiences.event: Death of older brother Dane in accident, leading to psychological trauma and enhanced sensitivity
formative_experiences.psychological_impact: Developed obsessive-compulsive tendencies and heightened perceptual abilities; established pattern of seeing hidden connections others missed

formative_experiences.event: Near-fatal illness followed by recovery and vision of rotating magnetic field principle
formative_experiences.psychological_impact: Mystical experience of scientific insight; developed belief in inspiration coming from beyond ordinary consciousness

formative_experiences.event: Emigrated to America with letter of introduction to Thomas Edison
formative_experiences.psychological_impact: Cultural displacement and struggle established fierce independence and determination to prove visionary ideas

formative_experiences.event: Demonstration of alternating current at World's Columbian Exposition, achieving international recognition
formative_experiences.psychological_impact: Public validation of AC system established confidence in ability to revolutionize technology and society

formative_experiences.event: Wireless power transmission experiments at Colorado Springs laboratory
formative_experiences.psychological_impact: Peak of creative inspiration and grandiose visions; deepened belief in ability to transform world through technological breakthroughs

key_relationships.influence: American inventor who initially employed Tesla but became opponent in 'War of Currents'; represented different approaches to invention and business
Industrialist who licensed Tesla's AC patents and funded development; provided resources for technological innovation while respecting scientific independence
Wall Street banker who funded Wardenclyffe wireless project but withdrew support; represented tension between visionary science and commercial practicality
Famous author who visited Tesla's laboratory and appreciated his genius; provided intellectual companionship and public advocacy for his work

inherited: Serbian Orthodox spiritual traditions and mystical consciousness
Austro-Hungarian intellectual sophistication and multilingual education
Slavic appreciation for poetry, music, and artistic beauty
Eastern European respect for scholarly achievement and learning
Family traditions of military service and intellectual distinction
rejected: American materialistic focus on immediate commercial profit
Edison's trial-and-error approach over theoretical understanding
Social conventions requiring inventors to compromise vision for business success
Nationalist limitations on scientific cooperation and knowledge sharing
Religious orthodoxy that conflicted with scientific investigation
synthesized: Universal wireless energy transmission for human benefit
Scientific invention as spiritual calling and cosmic purpose
Integration of artistic beauty with technological functionality
Technology serving human evolution and consciousness expansion

daily_routines: Dawn visualization and mental experimentation with electrical phenomena
Morning laboratory work on current projects and inventions
Afternoon walks for inspiration and mental calculation
Evening social interactions with intellectual elites and artists
Night intensive work periods during peak creative energy
work_methods: Complete mental design and testing before physical construction
Precise mathematical calculation combined with intuitive insights
Dramatic public demonstrations to showcase new technologies
Obsessive attention to detail and perfectionist standards
Integration of multiple sciences - physics, mathematics, engineering
social_behaviors: Eccentric personal habits and obsessive-compulsive rituals
Generous sharing of ideas with fellow scientists and inventors
Dramatic public presentations and scientific showmanship
Difficulty with intimate personal relationships and social conventions
Philanthropic vision of technology benefiting all humanity
coping_mechanisms: Intense work and creative absorption as escape from social difficulties
Grandiose visions of future technological utopia providing meaning
Mental experimentation and visualization replacing physical needs
Spiritual beliefs about cosmic consciousness and universal energy
Recognition from scientific peers and public for self-validation

contributions: Induction motor and rotating magnetic field
Vision of wireless global communication and power transmission
quotes: The present is theirs; the future, for which I really worked, is mine
If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration

primary_contributions: Induction motor and rotating magnetic field
